intro: Catostemma albuquerquei, commonly known as the Albuquerque catostemma, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
